item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 16, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Non-elementary group-by aggregations in Polars vs pandas (55 points | 17 comments)
2. Biological Miracle – Wood Frog (216 points | 54 comments)
3. First Impressions: Lenovo T14s with Qualcomm Snapdragon ARM64 CPU (67 points | 31 comments)

6. C++ Template Macroprogramming versus Lisp Macros (50 points | 24 comments)
7. Chimpanzees' performance on computer tasks changes when people watching them (37 points | 14 comments)
8. The price of shutting down coal power, and what would be gained (45 points | 48 comments)
9. Half-Life 2: 20th Anniversary Update (307 points | 111 comments)

12. Hackers now use ZIP file concatenation to evade detection (25 points | 12 comments)
13. The Battle Line at Louvain (115 points | 65 comments)
14. The Practical Guide to Scaling Django (73 points | 9 comments)

20. Retrofitting spatial safety to lines of C++ (26 points | 7 comments)

22. Four-wave mixing could boost optical communications in space (9 points | discuss)
23. Maybe Bluesky has "won" (269 points | 477 comments)
24. M4 MacBook Pros use a quantum dot (QD) film rather than a red KSF phosphor film (17 points | 11 comments)
25. A Visual Guide to the Aztec Pantheon (2022) (6 points | 1 comment)

27. Surveillance and the history of 19th-century wearable tech (21 points | 5 comments)
28. Costco’s butter recall, explained (39 points | 129 comments)
29. Installed an open source garage door opener, and I'm loving it (82 points | 32 comments)
